title.value: CARDINALITY MINIMIZATION, CONSTRAINTS, AND REGULARIZATION: A SURVEY
title.justification: The title clearly describes the content of the paper, which focuses on the survey of cardinality optimization in various contexts.
title.quote: We survey optimization problems that involve the cardinality of variable vectors in constraints or the objective function.

extractions.description: This paper surveys optimization problems that involve the cardinality of variable vectors in constraints or the objective function. It provides a unified viewpoint on problem classes and models, discussing techniques across different fields such as signal processing, portfolio optimization, and machine learning. The paper emphasizes the applicability of mixed-integer programming for solving these problems.

type.justification: The paper is a survey of existing theories and methodologies for optimization problems involving cardinality, rather than providing empirical experimental results.
type.quote: We provide a unified viewpoint on the general problem classes and models, and give concrete examples from diverse application fields.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on optimization problems involving cardinality in constraints or objectives.
name.quote: We survey optimization problems that involve the cardinality of variable vectors in constraints or the objective function.

name.justification: The paper discusses applications and optimization problems pertinent to signal processing.
name.quote: In signal processing applications, A is typically not fully generic but assumes certain forms and properties arising from an underlying physical measurement model or setup.

name.justification: Finance is another application domain where the discussed optimization problems arise, particularly in portfolio selection.
name.quote: Quadratic programs (QPs) with cardinality constraints play a crucial role in financial applications, in particular, portfolio optimization.

name.justification: Machine learning is a field where cardinality optimization problems are applied, particularly in regression and feature selection tasks.
name.quote: Cardinality aspects also play an important role in various applications in machine learning and data science.
